prompt:
"New Vocab:
lati (to borrow)

melo (money)

sehu (hundred)

u (indirect object)

Rules:
myu = conditional.

mye = past.

u = indirect object.

Number compounds: sehu = 100.

Object marked with e.

Verb stacking allowed.

Sentence Sample:
begu bay i myu mye lati u kyu e melo sehu.
Question:
Translate to English."
targets: If I had borrowed 100 units of money from you.
If I would have borrowed 100 money from you.
actual: If I had borrowed money from you, it would have been a hundred dollars.
raw_target: "If I would have borrowed 100 money from you. / If I had borrowed 100 units of money from you."
raw_actual: If I had borrowed money from you, it would have been a hundred dollars.

prompt:
"New Vocab:
sume (mature)

kuto (school)

daw (person)

twi (reorder prefix)

Rules:
twi reorders adjective-noun compounding.

Default: left-to-right compounding.

twi swaps interpretation.

Nouns can compound.

e marks predicate.

No i for “to be”.

Sentence Sample:
sume twikutodaw.
Question:
What does this mean vs. sumekutodaw?"
actual: Sumekutodaw means mature person with the adjective-noun compounding in default left-to-right order, while sume twikutodaw implies a reordering of the words due to 'twi', which could mean person mature or school mature, depending on whether interpretation is swapped.
raw_target: "Adult student (adult + school-person) vs. college student (adult-school + person)."
raw_actual: Sumekutodaw means "mature person" with the adjective-noun compounding in default left-to-right order, while sume twikutodaw implies a reordering of the words due to 'twi', which could mean "person mature" or "school mature", depending on whether interpretation is swapped.

prompt:
"New Vocab:
degu (war)

hido (city)

kwepay (below)

boy (preposition marker)

Rules:
boy = preposition marker.

kwepay = below (inverted pay).

teso = relative marker.

Location phrase after verb.

e marks object.

i marks verb.

Sentence Sample:
degu teso e hido i hay boykwepay baso.
Question:
Where is the war located?"
actual: degu teso e hido i hay kwepay.
raw_actual: degu teso e hido i hay kwepay.

prompt:
"New Vocab:
sole (happy)

kwe (invert)

byu (most)

gen (-ness)

Rules:
kwebyu = least (invert + most).

gen = abstract noun.

e marks predicate.

kwe inverts root.

byu superlative.

Compound: kwebyugeni.

Sentence Sample:
swe e kwebyusolegen.
Question:
What does kwebyusolegen mean?"

"New Vocab:
hesa (shark)

ludo (to protect)

seya (person title)

telu (in order to)

Rules:
telu = in order to.

begu = if.

myu = conditional.

u = indirect object.

Object e.

Verb stacking.

i before verb phrase.

Sentence Sample:
bay i ludo u seya e hesa telu begu bay i myu hay e helu.
Question:
Translate to English."
targets: I protect the person from the shark so that I would have safety.
actual: If a person title protects in order to prevent the shark, then if it is conditional that they will eat fish.
raw_target: "I protect the person from the shark so that I would have safety."
raw_actual: If a person title protects in order to prevent the shark, then if it is conditional that they will eat fish.
